translation: Zhou Zhaoyin, the fourth emperor, Śākyamuni was born in Kapilavastu, and King Mu, the fifty-third king of the nonreturners, reached the end of his eightieth year of true existence, and he died out 1,800 years before the teachings flowed from Han Ming to Yongping, before the Buddha was 422 years old, before Laozi was born in King Ding, before the Buddha was 477 years old, and according to the records of the stone pillars at Bodhidharma Temple in India, the Tathāgata died out.
